# Option Premium Calculator Documentation

## Overview
The Option Premium Calculator is a sophisticated web-based tool designed to calculate option premiums and Greeks using the Black-Scholes model. It provides real-time calculations for various cryptocurrency options, including Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Solana (SOL), Cardano (ADA), Polygon (MATIC), Base (BASE), and Arbitrum (ARB).

## Key Features
1. Real-time option premium calculation
2. Greeks calculation (Delta, Gamma, Theta, Vega, Rho)
3. Support for both call and put options
4. Integration with Deribit's DVOL for real-time volatility data
5. Interactive payoff diagram visualization
6. Multiple time-to-expiry input methods (date picker and duration)
7. Real-time cryptocurrency price updates via CoinGecko API

## Technical Implementation
- Built with React and TypeScript
- Uses the Black-Scholes model for calculations
- Implements WebSocket connections for real-time data
- Responsive design with mobile support
- Modern UI components with animations

## Use Cases
1. Options traders can use this tool to:
   - Calculate option premiums before placing trades
   - Understand option Greeks and their impact
   - Visualize potential payoffs
   - Compare different strike prices and expiry dates

2. Educational purposes:
   - Learn about options pricing
   - Understand the Black-Scholes model
   - Study the relationship between different option parameters

3. Risk management:
   - Calculate potential profits and losses
   - Analyze option sensitivities
   - Plan hedging strategies

## Integration Points
- CoinGecko API for real-time cryptocurrency prices
- Deribit WebSocket API for DVOL data
- Black-Scholes model implementation for calculations
